alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 11:08AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Oneida affecting Clay County. Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. Licking River near Salyersville affecting Magoffin County. For the Cumberland River...including Cumberland, Baxter, Pineville, Barbourville, Williamsburg...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Licking River...including Salyersville, Morehead...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.9 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 21.5 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 6 pm EST this evening.
